owl:Ontology.terms:creator: Raul Del Aguila
owl:Ontology.terms:description: OLM (Ontology of Learning Materials) Ontología de propósito general sobre recursos de aprendizaje para su consulta por alumnos y profesores
owl:Ontology.rdfs:comment: OLM (Ontology of Learning Materials) is a general purpose ontology (but not a general ontology) about learning resources materials whose aim is to be consulted by teachers and students

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Arrange is a property that relates an institution with a studyprogram
Author relates a person with a document made by that person
TeacherNotes can contains references or excepts of some books
A course is described in a syllabus
a Student is enrolled in a course
a slideshow is presented at a lecture
Notes are taken by a student
A resource resumes a lecture class
an institution set up a website
inverse relation of is taken by
a property that relates a teacher with a course

owl:Class.terms:description: Institution such as Universities or Schools that arranges study programs
Learning materials are prepared by teachers that works for an educational institution

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Notes taken by students in a lecture class
Material and resources to support teacher's lectures

owl:Class.terms:description: The syllabus contains the contents and reference material of a course
The bibliography with the materials of a course
Notes prepared by tachers that resumes some lectures and also can include extract from books

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A video can be hold and uploaded to a webpage and contains an explanation about a module of a subject
Lecture that is given in a room with students
this is a bias-class to represent a n-ary relation among document, webpage and teacher

owl:Class.terms:description: Lecture given by means of a web portal
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Lecture given by means of a web page/portal
Student enrolled in a study program arranged by an educational institution
Teacher that works in an educational institution

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: this object property is similar to isShownAt, but the subject is a slideshow instead of a video
this property relates a video with a lecture in which this resource is shown
